title: AI-generated misinformation has power to derail democracies: Jitin Prasada
description: Union Minister Jitin Prasada warns about artificial intelligence. He states AI misinformation can harm democratic systems. He also highlights AI's potential in education. However, he stresses AI should not replace teachers or weaken critical thinking. The government is working to make data available for AI development. Everyone must contribute to safe AI use.
content:

title: Revolutionizing River Flow Predictions with AI: IIT Delhi's Breakthrough
description: Researchers at IIT Delhi have advanced river flow prediction accuracy by merging traditional models with artificial intelligence. Testing 220 rivers in India, results showed improvement in 208. The AI-integrated method enhances water resource management by refining streamflow data, crucial for irrigation, flood reduction, and reservoir operations.
content:
In a groundbreaking study, IIT Delhi researchers have improved the accuracy of river flow predictions by integrating artificial intelligence with traditional models. This advancement could revolutionize water management across India.

title: Harnessing AI for Disaster Management: Bridging Technology and Policy
description: Artificial Intelligence (AI) is pivotal in disaster management, offering predictive analysis to minimize losses. However, effective implementation requires robust legal and policy frameworks to empower decision-makers. India's success in applying AI provides a model for other countries, emphasizing the need for scalable, legally-backed applications.
content: Artificial Intelligence (AI) is emerging as a crucial tool in disaster management, particularly in reducing potential losses. However, for AI technologies to be truly effective, a strong legal and policy framework is necessary. This would ensure that... [881 chars]

title: "FTA is another step in the deep relationship we have with India": New Zealand Minister Shane Reti
description: India and New Zealand have signed a Free Trade Agreement. New Zealand's Science and Technology Minister Shane Reti called it a significant milestone. He also praised India's growing global leadership in artificial intelligence. Both nations aim to collaborate on AI policy and responsible governance. This partnership will deepen bilateral ties and foster innovation with necessary safeguards.
